channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Vladimir Putin gifts purebred horses to Kim Jong-Un after arms support for Ukraine war
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin gifts 24 Orlov Trotters to North Korean leader Kim Jong-un, reflecting a deepening alliance. Reports indicate the horses are part of payment for artillery shells from North Korea aiding Russia's military efforts in Ukraine. This event underscores their growing military cooperation and significant geopolitical implications.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: UN and Palestinian authorities launches massive polio vaccination campaign in war-torn Gaza
item.description: Palestinian health authorities and UN agencies have initiated an extensive polio vaccination campaign in Gaza, aiming to vaccinate about 640,000 children. The drive faces significant challenges due to ongoing conflict, destruction, and displacement. The initiative underscores the urgent need for a temporary truce to allow families to safely access health facilities.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Melania hates Donald, prefers Kamala Harris', claims Trump ex-aide
item.description: Anthony Scaramucci, a former Trump aide, said on the MediasTouch podcast that Melania Trump would prefer Kamala Harris to win the upcoming election, alleging that she hates her husband, Donald Trump. He used this assertion as a measure of Trump's unpopularity. Though maintaining a low profile since January 2021, sources claim Melania supports Trump's re-election campaign.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ukraine drones target refinery, power plants in Moscow, Tver regions, Russia says
item.description: Ukraine launched drone attacks on power and refinery plants in Moscow and Tver, sparking fires. Russia claimed its air defense units destroyed 158 drones overnight, with no casualties reported. This escalation comes as Ukraine seeks permission from the US to use allied-supplied weapons for deeper strikes inside Russia, aiming to disrupt Moscowâ€™s war capabilities.

item.title: Florida teacher arrested for alleged abuse of autistic child at Forest Lake Elementary
item.description: A teacher in Volusia County with 36 years of experience faces a felony charge of child abuse after allegedly restraining a 3-year-old autistic student in a headlock. A paraeducator reported the incident, and the child showed physical distress. The teacher, Vilma Otero, is currently on administrative leave while the school district investigates.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pakistan's Karachi University deems high court judge's degree invalid after 40 years
item.description: The University of Karachi annulled the law degree of Islamabad high court Judge Tariq Mehmood Jahangiri, citing enrolment discrepancies from 1991. This decision came after the alleged detention of a syndicate member opposing the cancellation. The university discovered conflicting enrolment numbers, rendering the degree invalid.

item.title: Trump vs Kamala: Mark Cuban asks netizens who should children emulate, here are the results
item.description: Mark Cuban, minority owner of the Dallas Mavericks, ignited a social media debate asking whether children should emulate Donald Trump or Kamala Harris, with Trump winning 68.9 per cent of the votes. Cuban, previously a Trump supporter, now favors Joe Biden and supports Harris's economic proposals, criticizing Trump in several posts.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Hamas leaders will pay': US President Biden expresses outrage after Israeli-American hostage found dead in Gaza tunnel
item.description: President Joe Biden expressed devastation over the recovery of six hostages' bodies, including an Israeli-American, from Gaza. He condemned Hamas and vowed to secure remaining hostages. Israeli forces retrieved the bodies, including American Hersh Goldberg-Polin. Vice President Kamala Harris and Israeli President Isaac Herzog also condemned Hamas's actions, calling for an end to the conflict.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: â€˜Iâ€™m getting kicked off because ...â€™: Man kicked off Delta Airlines flight for wearing offensive Trump shirt
item.description: A Delta Airlines passenger was removed from a flight at Sarasota Bradenton International Airport for wearing a shirt with an obscene depiction of former President Trump. He initially altered the shirt but reverted it before takeoff. This action led to his removal under Deltaâ€™s policy against offensive attire.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Controlled explosion turns uncontrollable in London as film set catches fire in Silvertown's O2 arena
item.description: A controlled explosion at a film set near The O2 Arena in London erupted into a fire, prompting a swift response from firefighters. The incident, which resulted in no reported injuries, saw half a car and a lorry on fire. Loud bangs and smoke were noted by local residents, and the fire was soon controlled.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Prince Harry asks aides from UK to help him return 'from the cold': Report
item.description: Prince Harry has sought help from his old friends and aides in the UK, implying that his current situation in California isn't ideal. Turning away from Hollywood publicists, Harry aims for more time in the UK. He attended a memorial, marking a rare moment of reunion with his family earlier this month.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Bodies of six hostages found, Israeli military says they were killed prior to rescue
item.description: The Israeli military has identified the bodies of six hostages, including Israeli-American Hersh Goldberg-Polin, recovered from a Gaza tunnel. The hostages were killed by Hamas militants shortly before an Israeli rescue attempt. The discovery has intensified calls for negotiations to secure the release of the remaining hostages.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: What will happen to free speech in America if Kamala/Waltz gains power? Elon Musk answers
item.description: Elon Musk is concerned that his social media platform, X, could face challenges in the US if Kamala Harris and Tim Walz gain power. He points to recent issues in Brazil, where a Supreme Court order banned X. Musk believes such actions are unprecedented attacks on free speech in the 21st century. He also raised concerns about Harris and Walz speeches.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Hawk tuah spit on that thang': Man kicked out of Delta flight over Trump t-shirt
item.description: A Delta Airlines passenger was ejected from a flight for wearing a controversial shirt featuring Donald Trump flipping the bird and referencing a viral video. Despite initially complying with a request to turn the shirt inside-out after a complaint, the passenger reverted it back to its original position, leading to his removal just before takeoff.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: CNN replies to Trump supporter on allegations of editing Kamala Harris interview
item.description: CNN affirmed that its interview with Vice President Kamala Harris and Governor Tim Walz aired in full. This refuted online speculation by Trump supporters that it had been edited. Harris addressed key issues like climate change and GOP accusations about shifting policy stances, maintaining her values are consistent with her 2020 campaign.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ukrainian President Zelenskyy seeks approval for long-range strikes inside Russia
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy is urging the US to permit Kyiv to strike military sites deep within Russia to hinder Russian aerial bomb attacks. He stresses the necessity of advanced military capabilities and long-range weapon permissions from the US, Britain, France, and Germany, emphasising the urgency due to intense Russian missile strikes.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Iran's President Pezeshkian seeks $100 billion foreign investment, targets 8% economic growth
item.description: Iran's President Masoud Pezeshkian stated the country needs $100 billion in foreign investment for an 8% economic growth target. Emphasizing its importance for reducing inflation and unemployment, Pezeshkian's diplomatic visits to Iraq and the US aim to attract investment, focusing on reviving the nuclear deal.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: RFK Jr sues North Carolina elections board to get his name off state ballot
item.description: Robert F Kennedy has taken legal action against the North Carolina State Board of Elections to have his name removed from the ballot after halting his third-party presidential campaign and endorsing President Trump. The Board declined his request, referencing the significant cost and complexity due to nearly 2 million ballots already printed.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Russian spy' whale Havaldimir found dead in Norway
item.description: Havaldimir, the beluga whale known for wearing a harness, was discovered dead near Risavika, Norway. Spotted in 2019, he captivated public interest. The cause of death is still undetermined, though there are markings on his body. Marine conservationists are working to preserve his carcass for further analysis.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Former US President Trump hints at support for Florida ballot measure legalising recreational marijuana
item.description: Former President Trump is considering support for Florida's Amendment 3, aimed at legalizing recreational marijuana for adults. Trump stresses the importance of responsible legislation to prevent public nuisances, highlighting the inconsistency of criminalizing marijuana in Florida. Some Republicans, like Sen Rick Scott, oppose the measure due to personal experiences with addiction.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
